p: The PV represents the peroxides (primary oxidation products) produced by the oxidation process in fats. Primary oxidation products are broken down into minor substances, such as low molecular weight aldehydes, ketones, alcohols and short-chain hydrocarbons ( Kurtys et al., 2016; Strieder et al., 2019). The p-AV indicates the amounts of aldehydes and ketones (secondary oxidation products) and the TBARS value measures the formation of secondary oxidation products, such as malondialdehyde, alkenals, and alkadienals ( Shahidi et al., 2003). These measurements have been used to determine the oxidation status of fats and oils.
